com.hpe.caf.worker.document.model

Interface ResponseQueue

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DocumentWorkerObject

    public interface ResponseQueue
extends DocumentWorkerObject
    Used for managing the queue that response messages are published to.

    The queue may or may not be enabled. If the queue is not enabled then response messages published to it will be discarded.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disable()
      Disables the response queue.
      String getName()
      Returns the name of the response queue.
      Response getResponse()
      Returns the response customization object that this response queue object is associated with.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Returns true if the response queue is enabled.
      void reset()
      Resets the response queue back to its original state, undoing any changes made to it using the disable() or set() methods.
      void set(String name)
      Sets the response queue.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.hpe.caf.worker.document.model.DocumentWorkerObject

        getApplication

    • Method Detail

      • disable

        void disable()
        Disables the response queue. This causes response messages that would otherwise have been published to the queue to be discarded.

      • getName

        @Nonnull
String getName()
        Returns the name of the response queue. The isEnabled() call should be used before calling this method as it is only available if the queue is enabled. This method will throw a RuntimeException if the queue is not enabled.
        Returns:
        the name of the response queue
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the response queue is disabled

      • getResponse

        @Nonnull
Response getResponse()
        Returns the response customization object that this response queue object is associated with.
        Returns:
        the response customization object that this response queue object is associated with

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if the response queue is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the response queue is enabled

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the response queue back to its original state, undoing any changes made to it using the disable() or set() methods.

      • set

        void set(String name)
        Sets the response queue. If the specified response queue name is non-null then the queue will be enabled and the response queue name will be set. If the specified name is null then the response queue will be disabled. In this case the method is equivalent to calling the disable() method.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the response queue, or null to disable the queue
